google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello! The time on the widget displays the time that the weather data was last retrieved as opposed to a clock. Displaying the active time would require us to update the widget every minute which could have a tangible effect on battery life as the app would need to be loaded in the background constantly. Thanks for using Weather Doge!

We hope this resolves any confusion. Please feel free to contact us via support@versobit.com if you would like additional assistance.

How do you change then reading temperature to Fahrenheit for an American who uses a wacky metric system. Your app descriptions (pictures) clearly show the temperatures are in Fahrenheit, unless Bel Air has temperatures at 70 Celsius.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello Isaac! We automatically display Fahrenheit units when your device's locale is set to the United States, Liberia, or Burma. For all other locales it is set to metric. In the future we may introduce the ability to force Fahrenheit units as well. Thanks for using Weather Doge!

Would be a 5 star app easily if it was posible to remove the clock from the widget or have it as an offline clock. Why would the widget need internet connection to check the time? It goes out of sync when there is no internet connection.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Christian! The time display on the widget is meant to display the last time the weather information on the widget was updated. The Internet is required to update the weather, not the time. Thanks for using Weather Doge! We're available for more help at any time via support@versobit.com
